description: Students study computational problems arising from the need to store, access, transform,
and utilize DNA-related data.  Topics from computer science include: exhaustive search;
algorithms (including dynamic programming, divide-and-conquer, graph and greedy
algorithms) for fragment reassembly, sequence alignment, phylogenetic trees;
combinatorial pattern matching; clustering and trees; and hidden Markov models.  Offered
alternate years. Counts toward neuroscience, biomolecular studies, and mathematical biology
mathematics major. Prerequisites: CSCI 253, or one of CSCI 121 or CSCI 125,
and one of BIO 125 or MATH 220, or permission of instructor.
